# Data sources

Anshuo and Shengdi are both responsible for collecting the data. Our data mainly from Wikipedia. There are many useful and official dataset in Wikipedia.

1. List of iOS and iPadOS devices: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_iOS_and_iPadOS_devices
Explanation: This dataset contains a list of Apple’s devices and compares different features of those products. For instance, it compares power, storage, charging rate, and cameras for each Apple device. It can help us to visualize the difference of features among each generation of devices. By looking at the changes among those devices, we can estimate how fast they change in the past years. 

2. Comparison of Macintosh Models: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_Macintosh_models
Explanation: This dataset mainly compares Apple’s Macbooks in different generations. It compares features like storage, memory, and processors in a similar manner as the last dataset. By looking at the changes, we can visualize the rate of change among different generations.

3. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPhone 
Explanation: This dataset examines different generations of iPhones in more detail. It particularly includes the launch price for each generation of iPhone. This feature helps examine the relationship between the change of the products with the company’s sales and revenues. 

4. Finance Table: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Inc.
Explanation: The above Wikipedia page includes the financial data of Apple from 2000 to 2020. It contains the company’s revenue, net income, total assets, and number of employees across the years. This information helps us to understand Apple’s change of financial circumstances within the last ten years.

5. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_Apple_Inc._products
Explanation: This dataset includes the timeline of the release of each apple product. It shows the products that Apple continues to innovate and the products that Apple has tried to manufacture. This information helps us examine the motivations behind the change of each Apple product. 

6. Comparison of Smartphones: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_smartphones 
Explanation: This dataset compares different brands of smartphones, including iPhones. It helps us to see the changes in other smartphones, and then relate them to the changes we discover in iPhones. This relationship helps us to answer whether the change of Apple products is unique to itself. If the change can be seen in all smartphones, then we will discover more about the general technology market. 

7. Customer Satisfaction Index: https://www.macrumors.com/2020/05/19/apple-smartphone-customer-satisfaction-index/ 
https://www.theacsi.org/acsi-benchmarks/benchmarks-by-brand/benchmarks-for-smartphones 
Explanation: This dataset shows how customers are satisfied with iPhones and smartphones of other brands. We will analyze how customers reacted to the products’ changes over the years.
